channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Premier League star says he is gay in an open letter... but admits only his family and friends know
item.description: In the open letter, which is aimed at authorities and fans, he opens up of the daily tormet he currently faces and says he is taking the 'huge step' of opening up about it.

item.title: Madeleine McCann: Portuguese police 'launch search for body'
item.description: Portuguese police have reportedly conducted searches in a number of wells in Vila do Bispo, a 20 minute drive west of Praia da Luz where the Madeleine McCann vanished in May 2007.

item.title: FOURTEEN times: Over three years, Heard claims this is the tally of attacks Depp launched on her
item.description: Johnny Depp is suing The Sun for libel after it labelled him a 'wife beater'. He called the accusation 'utter falsity' and 'fraudulent' and claimed Amber Heard abused him throughout their marriage.

item.title: TikTok's rich list: Gordon Ramsay's family 'earn £142k' on app
item.description: Celebrities and their offspring have been flocking to TikTok to keep them and their fans entertained during lockdown.

item.title: JAN MOIR: Johnny Depp was like a cowboy in Dead End Gulch for a showdown with the law
item.description: Depp arrived in Court 13 before 10am, smartly dressed in a brown suit with a shirt and dark tie. With his clipped moustache and collar-length hair, he looked like a cowboy, says Jan Moir.

item.title: Serbia's president blames protesters for spreading virus as activists face off with mounted police
item.description: The Belgrade protests, which have been roaring for three days, have united people from both the left-wing and far-right in anger at Serbia's President Vucic.

item.title: Johnny Depp says Amber Heard taunted him over severed finger
item.description: Johnny Depp, 57, was re-examined by his barrister at the High Court in London today after days of damaging allegations by his ex-wife Amber Heard that he attacked her on 14 separate occasions.

item.title: China's Communist Party and the Tiger women now influencing the very heart of the Establishment
item.description: CLIVE HAMILTON: Democracy itself is assailed when CCP-linked organisations and Party proxies corrupt political representatives, and when Beijing co-opts powerful business lobbies.

item.title: Naya Rivera may have been swept away by 'sudden whirlpool' family of drowning victim claims
item.description: The family of Denise Arredondo says it's possible Naya Rivera may have been dragged underwater by a whirlpool at Lake Piru, where the nine-year-old girl drowned in 2009.

item.title: RICHARD KAY: Amber Heard is banking on this formidable legal duo to slip a stiletto into Johnny Depp
item.description: RICHARD KAY: While Jennifer Robinson may be hands-on in Team Amber, it is Sasha Wass, 62, whose skilled advocacy is being pitted against Depp and his claims.

item.title: Jodie Comer and Halle Berry are cancelled but it's not too late to fight back, says JOHN HUMPHRYS
item.description: JOHN HUMPHRYS: During most wars, there comes a point when the seemingly invincible attacking army faces a setback. It doesn't mean the war is over. Often quite the opposite.

item.title: DR MAX THE MIND DOCTOR: Hoping for a safe bet by gambling online? Now that IS high stakes
item.description: DR MAX PEMBERTON: I am increasingly worried that during lockdown - confined to the home with no structure and isolated from friends and family - many more will have fallen victim to online gambling.

item.title: Boris Johnson urges people to get back to offices in towns
item.description: The Prime Minister and Chancellor are said to be aghast at the impact empty offices are having on town centre shops and restaurants - and worried that homeworking is wrecking UK productivity.

item.title: Jada Pinkett Smith admits she DID have an affair with singer August Alsina
item.description: The 48-year-old sat down with Will Smith for a tell-all conversation on her Facebook show, Red Table Talk and revealed she developed a friendship with August around four years ago.

item.title: How Ghislaine Maxwell was arrogant during her 2016 interview with lawyers of Virginia Roberts
item.description: Her arrogance was ultimately her undoing. She could have exercised her rights under the Fifth Amendment which allows people to refuse questions that might incriminate them.

item.title: London Mayor Sadiq Khan spent £30k on boarding up statues
item.description: Figures released show it cost £10,147 to put a hoarding around the statue of Churchill. A further £21,115 was spent on protecting statues of Nelson Mandela and Mahatma Gandhi.

item.title: Honours scandal: Firm boasted it could get 'damehood for £80k'
item.description: A firm led by PR guru Paul Blanchard boasted it could win a gong for a celebrity author for £80,000, the Daily Mail reveals. This could undermine the entire honours system, which includes knighthoods.

item.title: Did Amber Heard swap face masks with her sister Whitney?
item.description: Amber Heard, 34, was spotted wearing the face covering, which has a strikingly similar pattern to that of her sister Whitney's, as she left the High Court in London earlier today.

item.title: How Chinese communists infiltrated Britain to push their party line
item.description: A new book claims senior politicians - on both the Right and the Left - are acting as 'useful idiots' to push the Chinese line at the top of government.

item.title: BEL MOONEY: My fiance doesn't want the baby I'm expecting
item.description: This week Bel advises a reader whose fiance doesn't want the baby she's expecting

item.title: Facebook is considering a ban on political ads in the days leading up to the U.S. election
item.description: After weeks of criticism for its inaction over posts from President Donald Trump, Facebook may move to blackout political ads in the lead up to the 2020 Presidential election.

item.title: Brooklyn Beckham, 21, 'ENGAGED to girlfriend Nicola Peltz, 25'
item.description: The photographer, 21, has apparently been telling his pals that he popped the question to his other half, 25, and it is common knowledge in their circle.

item.title: 'Sweatshop' owner of Boohoo factory confesses he pays workers a shocking £4 an hour
item.description: Displayed on a noticeboard in the foyer of a clothes factory, in the heart of Leicester's notorious garment district, is a list of the country's minimum wage requirements.

item.title: Women in early thirties could soon have eggs frozen on NHS
item.description: Mr Hancock said he was 'instinctively open' to the idea of the Government funding egg-freezing. Campaigners say this would enable more women to delay having a family until the right time.

item.title: A ringside seat with Princess Anne to mark her 70th birthday
item.description: Over recent months I have talked to scores of people who know her. 'Single-minded, fearless, driven, devoted to duty, loyal' - these are the words I heard again and again to describe her.

item.title: Tony Hadley tells JAN MOIR he would rather be on his own than in Spandau Ballet after toxic bust-up
item.description: JAN MOIR: Even pop stars must grow old, but it is rather a shock to learn that Tony Hadley recently celebrated his 60th birthday. 'It's a weird one, isn't it?' he says. 'How did that happen?'

item.title: MPs say BBC's rush to axe free licences for over-75s is a mess
item.description: The BBC's rush to axe free licences for millions of over-75s is a 'dog's breakfast' that will leave many confused and scared, MPs warned last night.

item.title: NASA updates policies to protect Moon and Mars from human germs
item.description: NASA is updating its Planetary Protection Policies to include more details of how humans can contaminate space with their germs, as the agency gears up for missions to the Moon and Mars.

item.title: Plans to replace guns with tasers 'lunatic', say police chiefs
item.description: Plans to remove firearms protection from VIPs at risk of attack are 'lunatic' and should be reviewed urgently by the Home Office, senior policing figures warned last night.

item.title: Konnie Huq says people have 'lost their manners' over picking up litter during lockdown
item.description: Miss Huq, 44, says the lockdown litter epidemic shows the 'worst of human beings'. The campaign is organised by Keep Britain Tidy and backed by the Daily Mail and will run from September 11 to 27.

item.title: Joanne Lees' stepfather says Bradley John Murdoch INNOCENT of outback slaying of Peter Falconio
item.description: Bradley John Murdoch was convicted of murdering Mr Falconio, 28, and assaulting Joanne Lees, then 27, on a stretch of the Stuart Highway near Barrow Creek, north of Alice Springs, in 2001.

item.title: Suffolk police hunt gang that stole four dogs and 13 puppies
item.description: The thieves removed hinges from gates before escaping with the dogs and puppies from the Fiveways Kennels near Mildenhall, Suffolk, between 3.45pm and 6pm yesterday.

item.title: Hilarious moment hamster stages a daring escape from its cage by shimmying up a wall
item.description: Kuro the black-and-white hamster climbed out his cage and up a wall in Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. His owner Yuka Hirata, 22, shared the pictures on social media earlier this week.

item.title: Enormous structure stretching 1.4BILLION light-year dubbed the 'South Pole Wall' found in space
item.description: The wall had remained undetected until now because large parts of it are half a billion light-years away and hidden by the bright Milky Way galactic centre.

item.title: Twitter amused by video of malfunctioning Disney robot
item.description: A Disney-focused Twitter account, The Magic Blitz, shared a video of the main character from Tomorrowland's Carousel of Progress.

item.title: 'Devastated' Jessica Mulroney has reached out to Meghan Markle
item.description: The Duchess cut ties with her best friend Jessica Mulroney after she threatened to sue black influencer Sasha Exeter in a series of messages.

item.title: Scientific study confirms again that 5G is 'harmless and benign'
item.description: The findings from a US study into the effects of radio-frequency radiation generated by the wireless technology suggests negligible health impacts on humans.

item.title: Murder investigation launched after East London double stabbing
item.description: A murder investigation is under way after a man, believed to be in his late teens or early 20s, was stabbed to death in Alexia Square in Poplar, east London.

item.title: Jewish blogger wins start of legal battle against Jeremy Corbyn
item.description: Jewish blogger Richard Millett complained about comments made by Jeremy Corbyn in a BBC television interview with broadcaster Andrew Marr nearly two years ago.

item.title: Driver 'in flip flops' drove car underneath another in horror crash
item.description: The driver was 'wearing shorts and flip flops' when he drove his red VW Golf under the Nissan Qashqai on Hagley road in Edgbaston. Police said no one was seriously injured.

item.title: First visitors to reopened Walt Disney World reveal the changes
item.description: Annual passholders have been exploring the reopened Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom theme parks at Walt Disney World ahead of the general public being let loose inside on Saturday.

item.title: Man walking to work is viciously mauled by bear in India
item.description: Video footage shows the shocking moment a man was severely injured after a bear attack while walking to work in Kashmir, India. It is the latest in a series of bear attacks in the Kashmir area this month.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell should be released on $5m bail say lawyers
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, 58, filed a request for her release on bail Friday as she 'vigorously denies' all charges against her.

item.title: Swiss firm to offer billionaires $500k vaults carved into mountain
item.description: The plan for the vaults has been put forward by Swiss firm Bruenig Mega Safe AG. They are set to be built in the Bruenig massif mountain near Lucerne, central Switzerland.

item.title: Cartel members hunt killer who shot El Chapo's nephew, 45
item.description: The body of Joaquín 'El Chapo' Guzmán's nephew, Enrique Guzmán, was found dead Wednesday inside a car that had been shot up by unknown attackers in Sinaloa, Mexico.

item.title: EasyJet accused of using sick leave to decide 4,500 job cuts
item.description: EasyJet has been accused of risking flight safety by making pilots redundant based on their sickness records. The airline is set to make 4,500 job cuts, a total which includes 727 pilots.

item.title: Legendary DJ Steve Sutherland dies: Trevor Nelson pays tribute
item.description: DJ Steve Sutherland, who worked on the UK club scene since the late 90s, had a loyal following on his shows on Choice and Galaxy FM.

item.title: Thug responsible for two horrific attacks jailed for 12 years
item.description: Jamie Forster, 21, has been jailed for 12 years for two separate horrific attacks on citizens in Greater Manchester. He claims to be a 'paedo-hunter' but both his victims were innocent.

item.title: Nigerian Instagrammer Hushpuppi 'kidnapped from Dubai by FBI'
item.description: Ramon Olorunwa Abbas - known to his followers as Ray Hushpuppi - was arrested in Dubai in June, and has since been taken to the United States, appearing before a Chicago court on July 3.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Arrests over £500k+ 'bounce-back loans' scam
item.description: Two men were arrested in London on Wednesday over an alleged scam to claim 'bounce back loans' from the Government's scheme to help small businesses affected by the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Ministers 'dodge wearing face masks in public'
item.description: Boris Johnson was seen wearing a face mask for the first time this afternoon while visiting shops in his Uxbridge constituency, having earlier hinted the coverings could be made compulsory in shops.

item.title: Elton John and Dua Lipa call for ban on LGBT conversion therapy
item.description: Sir Elton John, Stephen Fry and Dua Lipa have added their names to a petition sent by the Ban Conversion Therapy campaign group calling for an end to conversion therapies in the UK.

item.title: Gilead study says remdesivir reduces the risk of death in severely ill coronavirus patients
item.description: In a new study, nearly 75% of those treated with remdesivir recovered compared to 59% not given the drug and 7.6% of patients on the drug died compared to 12.5% of those not receiving it.

item.title: California waitress who ejected racist diner gets $82,000 in tips
item.description: Gennica Cochran, a server at Lucia restaurant in Carmel Valley, California, escorted Michael Lofthouse, 37, out after he yelled 'Trump is going to f*** you' at an Asian family enjoying a meal.

item.title: 17th-century PUB with operational bar up for rent on Airbnb
item.description: The 17th century Fitzhead Inn, in the tiny Somerset village of Fitzhead, has five en-suite rooms, a Mediterranean-style courtyard, a professional-standard kitchen - and a fully operational bar.

item.title: Tesco SCRAPS one-way aisles and eases coronavirus restrictions
item.description: Tesco will continue to enforce a two-metre gap between customers but the supermarket has announced it will remove its one-way system. It has reviewed its social distancing measures.

item.title: Amazon bans TikTok from employee devices due to security risks
item.description: A memo from Amazon to its staff surfaced online that mandates employees remove TikTok from devices with access to company emails by July 10 in order to retain mobile access to emails.

item.title: UK Weather: Temperatures to hit 74 degrees F this weekend
item.description: Britons are set for a sunny weekend with temperatures expected to hit 74F (23C) from tomorrow, with the mercury set to soar even higher next week.

item.title: Etchings of fighting CAMELS are the earliest ever drawings of the animal in Asia
item.description: A team from the Khakassian Research Institute for Language, Literature and History in Russia examined the tusk found in the lower Tom river in western Siberia.

item.title: Southerners get more than TWICE the Government life sciences funding per head those in the North
item.description: The Institute for Public Policy Research (IPPR) found that the North receives £4 billion less for health research annually than the South - with the Midlands the hardest hit.

item.title: Fitness trainer reveals how to prevent back pain and bad posture with SIX simple stretches
item.description: Chiara Becuti, head of Pilates for London-based fitness studio FLY LDN, has revealed the six exercises everyone should do at home to help keep their body pain-free.

item.title: Cornish estate including part of beach goes on sale for £8million
item.description: Sandy Acres, near Hayle, overlooks St Ives Bay, Cornwall, and has been in family ownership for 50 years. The estate includes ownership of part of Gwithian Beach.

item.title: Dogs shouldn't even be left alone in a car in the winter, scientists warn
item.description: Dog welfare experts monitored internal temperatures of cars in the UK, without dogs inside them, every day for two years.

item.title: Johnny Depp 'threatened to cut off Elon Musk's penis'
item.description: The actor has accused Ms Heard of having an 'extra-marital affair' with the SpaceX billionaire - which Musk vehemently denies and insists their relationship began only after she filed for divorce.

item.title: Naya Rivera 'dreamed of a long life and more kids' in memoir
item.description: Details from Naya Rivera's 2016 book resurfaced in the wake of her presumed death on Wednesday at Lake Piru when she apparently drowned on a boat trip with her four-year-old son Josey.

item.title: Police officer stabbed in London after chasing suspect with knife
item.description: Police officers pursued the male suspect in Hendon Way, north London, at around 1.15pm today before the knife-wielding man proceeded to stab a police constable in the arm.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: Days 'go slower' for 40% during lockdown
item.description: A Liverpool-based expert surveyed the impact that physical and social distancing measures have had on the UK population's feel for the passage of time.

item.title: Special constable dies months after being hit by car on duty
item.description: Resham Singh Nahal was described as an 'honourable officer' and a 'man of great faith' by West Midlands Chief Constable David Thompson.

item.title: The beauty treatments you can and still CANNOT get as nail bars and beauty salons reopen
item.description: Tory MP Caroline Nokes joined social media users in questioning why people cannot get their eyebrows waxed when men can have their beards trimmed.

item.title: Another Spanish tourist region put on alert after wedding guests test positive for coronavirus
item.description: Residents of Tudela and Pamplona in Navarra, northern Spain, are being advised to wear masks and stick to social distancing to prevent the disease spreading further.

item.title: BCG DOES protect against Covid-19, study confirms
item.description: US academics conducting a large-scale review of several studies found a clear link between the BCG vaccine used to protect against TB and a lower Covid-19 death rate.

item.title: Sheriffs release CCTV footage of Naya Rivera and her son Josey boarding boat
item.description: The Ventura Sheriff's Department released the footage Thursday, showing the 33-year-old and her four-year-old son arrive at the lake on Wednesday.

item.title: Man gets 4 years' jail for trying to steal 'priceless' Magna Carta
item.description: Mark Royden, 47, tried to steal the 800-year-old 'priceless' document yet failed to break through the toughened glass box at Salisbury Cathedral.

item.title: Istanbul's Hagia Sophia transformed into mosque by Erdogan
item.description: The move came hours after Turkey's highest court issued a landmark ruling that unanimously annulled the 1934 cabinet decision to renovate the Hagia Sophia in Istanbul into a museum.

item.title: Pfizer expects its coronavirus vaccine to be ready for approval by the end of the year
item.description: Pfizer and its German partner BioNTech SE are entering large-scale human trials this summer for their coronavirus vaccine and expect to seek FDA approval by the end of 2020.

item.title: Coronavirus: Stem cell therapy boosts survival rates FIVE-fold
item.description: Of a small number of patients treated in Spain, 15 per cent died compared with the 85 per cent expected. The treatment works by injecting patients with cells taken from fat tissue.

item.title: Coronavirus: Chinese virologist says outbreak WAS covered up
item.description: Dr. Li-Meng Yan, a former researcher at the University of Hong Kong, has claimed that she was one of the first to study the virus that became known as Covid-19, but that early research was covered up.

item.title: British air hostess 'living off bread and water in Dubai prison'
item.description: Derrin Crawford, 23, who works for Emirates and is based in the UAE, had been out for dinner with a man and agreed to go back to his flat when it was raided by officers who found two cannabis joints.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys want 'meritless' federal indictment dismissed
item.description: Laura Menninger, Ghislaine Maxwell's attorney, issued a formal response on Thursday to a civil suit filed against Maxwell in January. In it she described the recent charges as 'meritless'.

item.title: Coronavirus contact tracing apps flop in France and Australia
item.description: Britain has so far refused to put a contact tracing app out to the public but countries that have done so are facing major teething problems and finding they do not send alerts to many people.

item.title: Court hears tape of Johnny Depp asking Amber Heard to cut him
item.description: The audio recording taken by Amber Heard was yet another piece of evidence in her claims at the High Court in London that he abused her on 14 separate occasions.

item.title: Sobriety coach lists 11 signs you are drinking too much alcohol
item.description: Speaking exclusively to FEMAIL, sobriety coach Simon Chapple, from the UK, has revealed there are 11 main tell tale signs that you may have a drink problem.

item.title: Money and happiness linked more strongly in US now than in 70s
item.description: Professor Jean Twenge from San Diego University wrote for The Conversation about how money and happiness are more strongly related than they were in the 1970s.

item.title: Remote workers could relocate to Barbados under new...
item.description: Tourism makes up around 40 percent of Barbados' gross domestic product and has been directly impacted by the coronavirus crisis. The plan's goal is to encourage people back to the island.
item.media:description: Rockley Beach, Christchurch, Barbados. March 07 2007. (Rui Vieira/PA)

item.title: Coronavirus UK: R-rate may be ABOVE one in South West England
item.description: Number 10's expert advisory panel SAGE revealed the reproduction rate - the average number of people each Covid-19 patient infects - is still between 0.7 and 0.9 as a whole for the UK.

item.title: Sports Illustrated Swimsuit features first ever transgender model
item.description: The 23-year-old, who has also posed for Victoria's Secret, was photographed by Josie Clough on Scrub Island in the British Virgin Islands for the publication's 2020 issue.

item.title: British entrepreneur lives with MOTHER after bitter divorce
item.description: Richard Rothschild, 45, and Charmaine de Souza had a 21-year relationship after meeting as students, but a bitter split has seen him 'penniless' and the London company they shared handed over.

item.title: Sadiq Khan said he would rather be seen as 'weak' than shaking hands like Boris Johnson
item.description: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan told the Loose Women panel he would rather be seen as 'weak' than be dishonest about his mental health, and admitted he lost confidence.

item.title: Lorry driver charged over two deaths on smart motorway
item.description: Truck driver Prezemyslaw Zbigniew Szuba, 40, from Hull, has been charged following the deaths of Jason Mercer and Alexandru Murgeanu who died in a collision in south Yorkshire in June 2019.

item.title: Teenager accused of murdering PC Andrew Harper 'couldn't hear him'
item.description: Albert Bowers, pictured, claimed he could not hear PC Andrew Harper being dragged to his death behind a car he was in as it was playing loud music, the Old Bailey has heard.

item.title: Drink-driving woman jailed 28 months for killing man on date
item.description: Michael McMahon (pictured), 28. died after Lauren Iles, 26, lost control of her mother's BMW as she raced another car and crashed into a tree in St Albans.

item.title: Cruise ship industry blasts 'vague' Foreign Office advice telling ALL tourists not to go on cruises
item.description: Culture minister Caroline Dinenage said the government wanted to be 'a little bit more secure' that ships will not be plunged into coronavirus hotbeds once again.

item.title: Chicken Run star Julia Sawalha 'furious' after claiming she has been axed from film's sequel
item.description: Julia voiced Ginger in the original movie, and with the plot synopsis for the follow-up confirming the character's return, the actress hoped she'd be back.

item.title: Dame Vera Lynn: Crowds applaud flypast at star's funeral
item.description: The adored singer, who entertained troops with morale-boosting visits to the front line during the Second World War, died aged 103 on June 18.

item.title: Droves of easyJet customers are accusing the airline of running a 'SCAM'
item.description: Passengers have demanded answers from the carrier because many have had half of their trip cancelled meaning they are left with one flight they cannot use or cancel without paying fees.

item.title: Police unearth human remains thought to be those of missing nurse, 65, in woods
item.description: Nurse Judy Fox, 65, has been missing since a fire in her home in Shifnal, Shopshire. Her daughter Lucy has been charged with her murder and yesterday police said they had found human remains

item.title: Coronavirus: The long-term effects of lockdown on YOUR baby
item.description: Speaking to FEMAIL, five women shared their stories of how lockdown has impacted their children, all of whom are under the age of two, after Meghan Markle's comments.

item.title: Watchdog probe after teen called 999 and said 'I'm about to kill myself' hours before found hanged
item.description: The Independent Office for Police Conduct is probing Kent Police after Matty Mackell (pictured) died in Dunorlan Park, Tunbridge Wells.

item.title: Russian girl, 8, 'picked up by couple' who raped and killed her
item.description: Eight-year-old Vika Teplyakova was spotted on CCTV walking along a road on the Russian island of Sakhalin before she was picked up by the married couple who are alleged to have killed her.

item.title: Coronavirus Spain: Balearic Islands suffer first tourist outbreak
item.description: All three tourists who have tested positive for the virus on the Balearic Island of Menorca are Spanish. The family are now in isolation but are said to be showing no symptoms of the virus.

item.title: World map based on Google data illustrates where nationalities most want to go on holiday in 2021
item.description: On the map - generated using Google search data - country names have been supplemented by its residents' most yearned-for destinations for 2021, when international travel should be much easier.

item.title: Wimbledon to give out £10m prize money to 620 players
item.description: Wimbledon may not have happened this year, but the players will still reap the dividend of the tournament's foresight in maintaining its pandemic insurance.

item.title: Sheffield Utd striker Oliver McBurnie, 24, admits drink driving 'like iidiot' and is fined £30,000
item.description: Oliver McBurnie, 24, was caught by police in his black Audi A8 driving erratically back in November last year. Officers who did a breath test found him over one-and-a-half times over limit

item.title: Meghan Markle 'no intention' of living in UK, royal photographer claims
item.description: London-based veteran royal photographer Arthur Edwards, 79, has claimed that Meghan Markle, 38, married Prince Harry, 35, with 'no intention' of living in the UK.

item.title: Amazon deforestation surges by a quarter since last year
item.description: The rainforest in Brazil is also on course for its worse year on record and in the first half of 2020, 1,184 square miles (3,069 square kilometres) - an area ten times the size of Paris - was destroyed.

item.title: Coronavirus: Influencer sparks fears after hugging Siberian hermit
item.description: Agafya Lykova, 76, lives as if she was an 18th-Century peasant in the Siberian wilderness, in Russia, 150 miles from the nearest small town.

item.title: Golden retriever dog chases a pinching crab around beach
item.description: Mason, a three-year-old golden retriever would not leave a sand crab alone at the Outer Banks in Frisco, North Carolina, after he came across it for the first time.

item.title: Gatwick is eerily quiet today despite UK 'air bridges' coming into force
item.description: Gatwick was quiet despite quarantine-free links with 73 countries starting up from this morning as an exclusive poll shows that under a fifth of Britons intend to go abroad

item.title: New pathogen may have caused Botswana elephant deaths
item.description: Six new elephant carcasses have been discovered in the African country, taking the total since May to 281 (one of the carcasses is pictured in the Okavango Delta).

item.title: Woman in bikini thrown to floor by police after car crash 'dance'
item.description: The brunette, wearing just swimwear and sunglasses, was handcuffed and arrested following her bizarre reaction to the collision in Lepe, near Huelva in south-west Spain.

item.title: Johnny Depp tells court Ellen Barkin holds a grudge against him
item.description: The American actor (pictured together) said his former flame, 66, who accused him of being abusive and 'jealous' while they filmed the cult classic together, held a 'grudge.'

item.title: This Morning set to 'hire a black presenter for the first time in its 32 year history'
item.description: Last month, The Mail on Sunday revealed that the programme's editor Martin Frizell is seeking to change the line-up to include a black presenter

item.title: Coronavirus France: Fears as R-number edges above 1
item.description: Officials from Public Health France warned that the the rate was now 1.05 and indicates a transmission that is allowing the virus 'to be maintained or even to progress', as cases continue to rise.

item.title: Elon Musk seems to RETRACT political support of Kanye West
item.description: When asked if he remains supportive, he responded in a tweet reading: 'We may have more differences of opinion than I anticipated'

item.title: Delighted women share before and after snaps of their hair
item.description: Delighted women across Britain and further afield have shared their post-lockdown hair makeovers as salons open their doors for the first time in three months.

item.title: Social media users share snaps of VERY funny signs they've spotted
item.description: People from across the globe have taken to a Reddit thread and shared photos of some of the funniest signs they've come across on their travels - including some very awkward typos.

item.title: Author claims he saw a 'worrying' Michael Jackson home video
item.description: Dylan Howard, the former National Enquirer editor involved in the US newspaper's 'Peckergate' feud with Jeff Bezos, claims that 'the scene was worrying and baffling'.

item.title: Asian American insulted by tech CEO says apology insincere
item.description: Michael Lofthouse, 37, was filmed hurling racist abuse at Raymond Orosa and his family in a Carmel Valley, California, restaurant. Mr Orosa said Lofthouse's apology was just 'saving face'.

item.title: Man jailed for four years after glassing woman who rejected him
item.description: Jamie Simpson, 30, pictured, was jailed for 51 months by Isle of Wight Crown Court and banned from contacting his victim Yavana Dix, 21, for life after admitting assault and GBH.

item.title: Can YOU guess which celebrity lives in this London home?
item.description: Viewers will be offered a dogs' eye view of a home in London in new channel 4 show, Celebrity Snoop Dogs - but can you guess the model it belongs to?

item.title: China 'aims for new 'Berlin Wall' in Hong Kong with security law'
item.description: Wu Jieh-min, a scholar in Taiwan, claimed Beijing was isolating Hong Kong with an invisible barrier just like how West Berlin was physically cut off from democratic West Germany by the Berlin Wall.

item.title: Meghan Markle's white outfits 'represent unity, purity and virtue'
item.description: Meghan Markle, who is currently living with the Duke, 35, and their son Archie, one, in LA, wowed fans with her colourful wardrobe during her last few engagements in the UK back in March.

item.title: Scientists warn UK Government to prepare for 'visible resistance' to future lockdowns
item.description: Papers published today from the Scientific Advisory Group for Emergencies show behavioural experts have warned trying to bring back lockdowns 'might evoke various responses'.

item.title: Water supplies could RUN OUT in parts of England within 20 years
item.description: A damning report claims 'no progress' made in reducing leakage, 'very little' achieved in reducing demand and a 'far too ponderous' approach taken to improving water infrastructure.

item.title: Johnny Depp 'threw a phone' at 'Amber Turd' because she 'defecated' in their bed
item.description: Depp, 57, is suing The Sun for libel in London after it called him a 'wife beater' following claims by his ex-wife Heard, 34, that he repeatedly attacked her during their relationship.

item.title: Charlie Elphicke said he was 'not happily married' before grope
item.description: Former Conservative MP Charlie Elphicke, 49, denies three counts of sexual assault, but it was claimed today in court he told one woman he was in an unhappy marriage before groping her

item.title: Lord Mountbatten and heiress wife 'both had bisexual affairs'
item.description: A new three part series, The Private Lives of the Royals, kicks off with Lord Mountbatten, the naval commander who introduced the Queen to nephew Phillip, and later became a mentor Charles.

item.title: Charity bosses face jail for keeping over £500k cash
item.description: David Papagavriel (pictured), 57, Terence Kelly, 73, Ian Ellis, 58, and Peter Ellis, 30, face jail after admitting fraud by abuse of position.

item.title: Prince Charles and Camilla say they 'REFUSE to retire'
item.description: Prince Charles, 71, and Camilla, 72, were chatting with workers at an Asda distribution centre in Bristol, when the duchess made a rare reference to the couple's future plans for retirement.

item.title: Woman gets home to find BOLLARD installed in parking space
item.description: Jasmine Frank was shocked to see the obstacle blocking her access when she returned to her property in Cornwall.

item.title: Girl who grew up in care graduates from Cambridge University
item.description: 'Exceptionally talented' Kasmira Kincaid, from Lampeter, Ceredigion, has gone viral online after battling through hardship to graduate from one of the world's most prestigious universities.

item.title: Bernie Ecclestone says he would not change his son's nappies because 'that's what wives are for'
item.description: Speaking from his home in Switzerland with his wife Fabiana Flosi, 44, Bernie Ecclestone, 89, told This Morning he'd stayed out of the delivery room because he preferred to watch the video afterwards.

item.title: Covid-19 pandemic 'accelerating', WHO warns
item.description: The director general of the WHO, Dr Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, said the virus is not under control 'in most of the world' and is in fact 'getting worse'.

item.title: Man, 51, killed by punch outside Screwfix in queue-jumping row
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Andrew Webster, 51, died after he was attacked outside the Screwfix store, in Warrington, Cheshire. A 24-year-old man arrested on suspicion of assault had been bailed.

item.title: Touching moment couple married for 69 years held hands for last time as they shared final goodbye
item.description: John Wilson, 92, clasped hands with wife Marjorie, 88, as they share one last moment together side-by-side in hospital beds. The emotional picture was taken by a quick-thinking ward sister

item.title: Women reveal the WORST backhanded compliments they've received
item.description: Women from around the world have taken to the secret sharing app Whisper to reveal the worst backhanded compliments they've received from loved ones, employers and strangers.

item.title: Royal Mail is fined £1.5m for failing to deliver 93% of first class post within one working day
item.description: The communications regulator said Royal Mail missed its target in the financial year ending in 2019, with only 91.5 per cent of first-class post reaching its destination on time.

item.title: Husband bursts into tears of joy when wife surprises him with a puppy for his 25th birthday
item.description: Daniel Totos thought he was unwrapping a watch on his 25th birthday in Adelaide. Instead wife Ashley walked in the room holding German shepherd puppy Monty.

item.title: 'Sort it Gandalf!': Sir Ian McKellen urged to act after his pub 'threatened to sack' scared barman
item.description: Barman Daniel Richardson said he burst into tears after getting a message from a pub owned by Lord of the Rings star Sir Ian McKellen threatening to let staff go if they refused to go into work

item.title: Calls for Rule, Britannia! to be banned from Last Night of the Proms
item.description: Music critic Richard Morrison said when at the Last Night of the Proms he often sees people in the posh seats who were not at any other nights, singing the 'jingoistic' songs without any irony.

item.title: China faces 'DISASTER' with the insects already invading southern city, officials warn
item.description: Swarms of yellow-spined bamboo locusts have destroyed about 26 square miles of fields in Pu'er after raiding the city from China's border with Laos, the local government said.

item.title: Two-thirds of Britons back Boris Johnson's refusal to 'take the knee'
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: A poll for MailOnline found 67 per cent support the PM's view that he will not engage in 'gestures' and people should not be 'bullied' into it.

item.title: NASA starts building its spacecraft which will explore a metal-rich asteroid
item.description: NASA has finished designing and started building a spacecraft that will fly to the metal-rich asteroid Psyche, launching on a SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket in August 2022.

item.title: Horror as female nursery worker dies in 'tragic accident' at childcare centre
item.description: Police and paramedics raced to the Kiddi Caru childcare centre in Plympton, Plymouth, yesterday afternoon, where the woman was tragically pronounced dead at the scene.

item.title: Moment new tire flies off family car and crashes into oncoming vehicle shortly after it was fitted
item.description: A tire broke away from a car 30 minutes after being fitted and crashed into an oncoming vehicle in Albuquerque, New Mexico. The driver was helpless as his new tire rolled down the other side of the street.

item.title: Kate Middleton and Sir Andy Murray join forces for a video call with children to mark Wimbledon end
item.description: Kate Middleton, 38, doubled up with champion Sir Andy Murray, 33, for a video call with children from Bond Primary School in Mitcham, south London.

item.title: Bernie Ecclestone addresses Lewis Hamilton's claims ethnic minorities are underrepresented in F1
item.description: The business mogul, 89, appeared on This Morning on Friday with his wife Fabiana, 44, where he said Formula 1 was 'open to anyone'.

item.title: Matt Hancock says ban on care home visits will be lifted 'in the coming days'
item.description: Now the daily deaths have fizzled out, there is the promise of care home closures 'coming to an end very soon' the Health Secretary said.

item.title: Last moments of Seoul mayor as he set off to kill himself following sexual harassment allegations
item.description: Newly released CCTV footage shows Park Won-soon, 64, wearing a blue cap, dark jacket and trousers, walking down an alley as he made his way to his suicide spot in the northern Seoul mountains.

item.title: Gangs pose 'greatest danger' to young black men NOT police, says equality champion Trevor Phillips
item.description: The former head of the Commission for Racial Equality said young black men should realise gangs were the greatest threat to them. But he did say they were targeted more by police stop and searches

item.title: ANOTHER mystery blast in Iran as explosion heard in Tehran with electricity cut in city suburb
item.description: The reported blast in western Tehran is the latest in a string of explosions to have swept across Iran in recent weeks, amid suspicions that Israel may have been behind at least one.

item.title: Ricky Gervais says The Office would not get made today due to online 'outrage mobs'
item.description: The comedian and actor, 59, who played David Brent in the BBC mockumentary, said UK broadcasters are now too afraid to take risks.

item.title: Goat to get a trim! Mountain goats form orderly queue outside barbers in Welsh town
item.description: Four shaggy-haired mountain goats were photographed appearing to queue up outside a closed barbership in Llandudno, Wales.

item.title: American Noah Lyles appears to smash Usain Bolt's 200m record... only to discover start line mix-up
item.description: Lyles put in what looked like a sensational run timed at 18.91 seconds at the Inspiration Games in Florida, which would have beaten Bolt's 19.19 world record. But then a mistake was discovered.

item.title: Extras on Britain's best-loved TV shows like EastEnders face axe as producers keep sets Covid safe
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Many have been forced to find job elsewhere stacking supermarket shelves or volunteering with the NHS and other key services as they wait to see whether they will return to TV.

item.title: Licence fee chaos as paying system is already unable to meet demand due to coronavirus staff cuts
item.description: Culture Secretary Oliver Dowden said he feels 'let down' by the decision and that the decision will 'have an impact' on proposals to decriminalise the licence fee.

item.title: Doomed zebra is flipped into the air by crocodile as it meets a gruesome end in Kenya
item.description: The scene was pictured in Kenya by financial consultant Dennis Stogsdill, 50, from Chappaqua, New York, during a trip to the Mara Triangle in the south of the country.

item.title: Civil servants 'circulate dossier on Dominic Cummings'
item.description: Dominic Cummings is said to have warned privately that a 'hard rain' is coming for Whitehall, with a slew of senior figures already having been ousted.

item.title: What a night out with Prince Andrew is REALLY like
item.description: Writing in Times 2, UK-based Vassi Chamberlain claimed that on a night out 'sexy young women' would throw their hands all over the eighth-in-line to the throne - who they refer to as 'Andy'.

item.title: Quarantine-free stays begin today for UK arrivals from more than 70 nations and territories
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Research for MailOnline found limited appetite among the public for heading for sun-drenched beaches, despite the lifting of draconian quarantine measures on many countries.

item.title: Savvy mum transforms dull and dark spare room into a light-filled beauty haven for £300
item.description: Monika Bacanskaite, 22, from Somerset told money-saving community LatestDeals.co.uk how she transformed her dark and dull spare room into a chic and stylish beauty haven for £300.

item.title: Customer service employees reveal the rudest things they've experienced in their jobs
item.description: Twitter users have shared the rudest customers they've experienced in customer service jobs in a thread started by Kirsten, from the US including being thrown things at and screamed at.

item.title: Home for sale is a mini-Kew Gardens with its own orangery
item.description: The five-bed property has an extensive orangery that occupies almost half of the property, extending across two floors.

item.title: Brainteaser challenges puzzlers to spot the hidden bee amongst the flowers
item.description: The puzzle, created by UK-based company Swift Direct Blinds, shows blooms of all colours and shapes, with just a single insect hidden somewhere in the scene.

item.title: France to restore Notre-Dame Cathedral as it was before
item.description: Paris' centuries-old Notre-Dame Cathedral will be rebuilt as it was before being engulfed in a fire last year, the public body in charge of its restoration said on Thursday.

item.title: Ex-Liverpool doctor recalls moment he had to stitch Liverpool captain Steven Gerrard's penis
item.description: A doctor recalled the shocking moment he had to stitch Steven Gerrard's penis together after he injured it during an FA Cup match for Liverpool against Bournemouth in 2014.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... magic money trees
item.description: 'We're after one of Rishi's magic money trees to help pay for our TV licence'
